page.title: 11Shopping in Linlithgow.
page.content: People living at the west end of Linlithgow were asked for their opinions on shopping facilities in the town.As a result of this survey,we found that one of the main complaints was about the siting of the shopping complex at the east end of the town.Transport seemed to be one problem and this prevented them using the complex regularly.Another complaint was the lack of parking facilities in the town.Though the provision at the shopping complex is satisfactory,elsewhere it is very difficult to find a parking space. Many people complained about the lack of certain kinds of shops-in particular children's clothes shops. Some people still prefer to do the bulk of their shopping in Edinburgh or Falkirk as prices are cheaper and there is more variety.
